{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Use British English|date=March 2018}} {{Italic title}} The '''''Aberdeen Bestiary''''' ([[Aberdeen University]] Library, Univ Lib. MS 24) is a 12th-century [[England|English]] [[illuminated manuscript]] [[bestiary]] that was first listed in 1542 in the inventory of the [[Old Royal Library]] at the [[Palace of Westminster]].<ref name=Aberdeen>{{cite web|title=History|url=https://www.abdn.ac.uk/bestiary/history.hti|publisher=University of Aberdeen|accessdate=5 November 2015}}</ref>
Information about its origins and patron are circumstantial. It probably comes from the 12th century and was owned by a wealthy ecclesiastical patron of the north or south province. The ''Aberdeen Bestiary'' is related to other [[bestiary|bestiaries]] of the [[Middle Ages]] such as the ''[[Ashmole Bestiary]]''.<ref name=Aberdeen/> The Aberdeen Bestiary and the Ashmole Bestiary are considered by Xenia Muratova, a professor of art history, to be "the work of different artists belonging to the same artistic milieu."<ref name=":1" /> Due to their "striking similarities" they are described by scholars as being "sister manuscripts."<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|chapter-url=https://books.google.de/books?id=tYJ1AAAAIAAJ&q=beasts+and+birds+of+the+middle+ages&dq=beasts+and+birds+of+the+middle+ages&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwj8373ziI_iAhWO_qQKHTi8D-UQ6AEIKjAA|title=Beasts and Birds of the Middle Ages|last=Muratova|first=Xenia|publisher=University of Pennsylvania Press|year=1989|isbn=0-8122-8147-0|editor-last=Clark|editor-first=Willene B.|location=Philadelphia|pages=53–63|chapter=Workshop Methods in English Late Twelfth-Century Illumination and the Production of Luxury Bestiaries|editor-last2=McMunn|editor-first2=Meradith T.}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=The Bestiary|last=James|first=M. R.|publisher=Roxburghe Club|year=1928|isbn=|location=Oxford|pages=14ff., 55–59}}</ref> The [[Medieval studies|medievalist]] scholar [[M. R. James]] considered the Aberdeen Bestiary <nowiki>''</nowiki>a replica of Ashmole 1511".<ref name=":0" />
== Creation == [[File:AberdeenBestiaryFolio005rAdamNamesAnimalsDetail.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 5 recto : [[Adam (Bible)|Adam]] names the [[animal]]s.]] [[File:AberdeenBestiaryFolio008rTigerDetail.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 8 recto : [[Tiger]] (''Tigris'').]] [[File:AberdeenBestiaryFolio008vLeopardDetail.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 8 verso : [[Pard (legendary creature)|Pard]] (''Pardus'').]] [[File:AberdeenBestiaryFolio009rPantherDetail.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 9 recto : [[Panther (legendary creature)|Panther]] (''Panther'').]] [[File:F11v-aberdeen-best-detail.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 11 verso : [[Hyena]] (''Yena'').]] [[File:F13r-aberdeen-best.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 13 recto : [[Satyr]] (''Satyrs'').]] [[File:F15r-aberdeen-best-detail.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 15 recto : [[Monocerus|Monoceros]] (''Monoceros'').]] [[File:Aberdeen ram.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 21 recto : [[Sheep|Ram]] (''Aries'').]] [[File:Aberdeen Lamb.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 21 recto : [[Domestic sheep|Lamb]] (''Agnus'').]] [[File:Aberdeen Bestiary - Owl.JPG|thumb|right|Folio 35 verso : [[Night heron]] (''Nicticorax'').]] [[File:Phoenix rising from its ashes.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 55 verso : [[Phoenix (mythology)|Phoenix]] (''Fenix'') rising from its ashes.]] [[File:Phoenix detail from Aberdeen Bestiary.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 56 recto : [[Phoenix (mythology)|Phoenix]] (''Fenix'').]] [[File:Perindens.jpg|thumb|right|Folio 65 recto : [[Perindens tree]] (''Perindens'').]]
* Folio 1 (i.e., leaf) [[recto and verso|recto]]: [[Genesis creation narrative|Creation]] of [[heaven]] and [[earth]] (''[[Book of Genesis|Genesis]]'', 1: 1-5). * Folio 1 [[Recto and verso|verso]]: Creation of the [[water]]s and the [[firmament]] (''Genesis'', 1: 6-8). * Folio 2 recto : Creation of the [[bird]]s and [[fish]]es (''Genesis'', 1: 20-23). * Folio 2 verso : Creation of the [[animal]]s (''Genesis'', 1: 24-25). * Folio 3 recto : Creation of [[man]] (''Genesis'', 1: 26–28, 31; 2: 1-2). * Folio 5 recto : [[Adam (Bible)|Adam]] names the [[animal]]s ([[Isidore of Seville]], ''[[Etymologiae]]'', Book XII, i, 1-2). * Folio 5 verso : [[Animal]] (''Animal'') (Isidore of Seville, ''Etymologiae'', Book XII, i, 3) * Folio 5 verso : [[Quadruped]] (''Quadrupes'') (Isidore of Seville, ''Etymologiae'', Book XII, i, 4) * Folio 5 verso : [[Livestock]] (''Pecus'') (Isidore of Seville, ''Etymologiae'', Book XII, i, 5-6) * Folio 5 verso : [[Pack animal|Beast of burden]] (''Iumentum'') (Isidore of Seville, ''Etymologiae'', Book XII, i, 7) * Folio 5 verso : [[Herd]] (''Armentum'') (Isidore of Seville, ''Etymologiae'', Book XII, i, 8)

After folio 15 verso some leaves are missing which should have contained [[crocodile]] (''Crocodilus''), [[manticore]] (''Mantichora'') and part of [[parandrus]] (''Parandrus'').
